channel.title: Rainbow Partyhat [PI]

item.title: Rainbow Partyhat [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

[quote=“browngobbler, post:4, topic:551260”]Ok, I will try to go and find one.
Thanks![/quote]
Alright, if you want one, here you go: http://uppit.com/sdlah5zm27h7/Rainbow.rar

The ints:

case xxxx: itemDef.modelid = xxxx; itemDef.name = "Rainbow Partyhat"; itemDef.description = "Rainbow Partyhat."; itemDef.modelZoom = 440; itemDef.modelRotationX = 1845; itemDef.modelRotationY = 121; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 1; itemDef.anInt165 = xxxx; itemDef.anInt200 = xxxx; itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear"; break;

Change “xxxx” accordingly.

Read full topic

item.title: Rainbow Partyhat [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

First of all, that is a horrendous rainbow partyhat. I’m sure you can find a much better one looking around.

Check to see if you added those models to your client, and if so check to see if your female wield works. That way we can narrow it down to if the it’s the model, or you. But in all honesty, get a new rainbow partyhat.

Read full topic

item.title: Rainbow Partyhat [PI]
item.dc:creator: @beale beale
item.description:
@beale wrote:

Most likely an issue with your model. Either you are missing a .dat model file or you have the wrong ones. Check the ints for the item and make sure you have the correct models

Read full topic

item.description:

case 11863: itemDef.name = "Rainbow Partyhat"; itemDef.modelID = 16252; itemDef.modelZoom = 450; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 120; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 99; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 3; itemDef.modelOffset2 =-4; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 16246; itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 16248; itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wear"; itemDef.description = "Woah, look at the pretty colors!".getBytes(); break;

Sorry if this is the wrong section!
